column1: good length, just outside off stump, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, driven firmly to mid'off's left. Kevin O'Brien there, puts in a dive low to his left
full at middle stump, pushes across the line and chips it with litte control to the right of mid-on
back of a length, angled in at the batsman who goes deep and whips it past short fine and well to the right of deep square leg
good length at middle stump, turned to short fine with the wrists
full at middle stump, gets a short stride in and punches it between non-striker and stumps with the full face
good length and fired down the leg side, left alone
full at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length, arm ball slides in at middle stump, catches him on the pad and lobs in front of first slip as he tries to flick it
shot. Good length at middle stump, gets a large stride out, gets to the pitch and rolls his wrists nicely to keep the ball grounded as he sweeps past short fine
back of a length at middle stump, defended to midwicket
good length at off stump, he pushes forward to defend and gets a thick inside edge into the leg side
back of a length outside off, punched back to the bower off the back foot
good length at off stump, hangs back, no feet, as he flicks it to deep square
good length at leg stump, shapes to flick it and checks his shot at the last moment, pushes it back to the bowler
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length outside off, pushed to point off the front foot
good length outside off, goes forward and opens the face to push it to point
good length, drifted down the leg side, he goes forward and stabs at it, thick inside edge to short fine
back of a length at middle, goes deep in the crease and flicks it past short midwicket

good length, angled down the leg side, pushes it to short fine and nearly gets run-out at the other end. He was lazy with that run and had to scramble quickly as the throw came in and just missed the direct hit
good length at leg stump, worked into the leg side with the wrists
good length at leg stump, pushed past midwicket off the front foot
full at leg stump, stretches forward and sweeps it behind short fine off the middle of the bat
good length at middle stump, driven on the upto mid-on
what a shot that is. This one is good length at middle stump, he hangs back and lifts one leg as he short-arm jabs this to deep square leg. Most people would've played forward to that
shot. Full at middle stump, on-drive is timed sweetly, but straight to the fielder
good length at middle stump, goes forward and nudges it to midwicket's right
good length outside off, feet rooted to the crease as he pushes at it away from the body, and back to the bowler
full and angled in at off stump, defended solidly this time with a short stride
overpitched outside off, gets to the pitch and drives it straight to cover
good length, angled in at off stump, leans in, drops his head slightly to the off side and taps this into the midwicket region with soft hands
uff! Good length outside off, no feet again as bludgeons this to mid-on on the up...and he will have a free hit to try and bludgeon another one now
short and wide outside off, Shahzad shuffles across in his crease, makes enough room and slaps the ball over extra cover
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, one leg in the air as he tries to pull this one, gets an inside edge that flies over the stumps and into the fine leg boundary
short and wide, goes for the pull again, but the ball hurries on him and he can only get it off the sticker to mid-on
full outside off, gets a stride across and drives to mid-on
good length, angled in at middle stump, plonks his foot across and flicks to deep square leg
full at off stump, loses his balance as he pushes far in front of his body to defend this
short and wide, backs away and taps it to short extra cover
good length outside off, nips away slightly after pitching and catches the outside edge, but there's no one in the slip cordon
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the front foot
short at middle stump, goes deep and slaps the pull in front of square leg

poor fielding. Not so great bowling either. Short at middle stump, goes on the back foot and whips it straight to short fine where the fielder has barely even crouched as it goes through him. Murtagh with that effort.
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot into the leg side
back of a length outside off, feet off the ground as he punches this into the off side
full at off stump, offers the full blade and punches it past the bowler. Mid-on gets across and puts in a dive, nbut he parries it to the long-off boundary and that is the fifty partnership
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length outside off, puts a stride across and pushes it towards mid-on
full at middle stump, stride across and driven firmly to mid-on
good length in the corridor, goes back and punches him to mid-on like he would a spinner
back of a length outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended to point off the back foot
good length, angled in at middle stump, pushed to deep square leg off the pads
good length at middle stump, walks across the stumps and tries to work it into the leg side, gets it on the thigh guard and it rolls to short fine
short at middle stump, swivels and pulls this to short fine's left, and this time Murtagh gets down quickly and stops it on the bounce
short at middle stump, hangs back and pulls straight to deep square

good length at off stump, pushes it to mid-on on the up and takes off for the run. Mulder completely misses the ball as he runs in to try and fire it at the stumps. Mid-off runs across a long way to clean up

dropped! Kevin O'Brien has put down a simple one. Legspinner drops it short at middle stump, hurries him as he goes for the pull. It's a top edge that hangs up in the air, a few yards behind O'Brien at midwicket who takes this one casually and is well away from it in the end as he puts his hands out
short at middle stump again, goes deep and pulls it over the midwicket boundary
good length at off stump, pushed into the off side off the back foot
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man

could be run-out here, third umpire has been called for. Pushes it into the leg side, to the right of midwicket who runs across, picks up and fires at the non-striker's end in one smooth motion. The replays show he was ambling across lazily. There was some doubt with the bowler's hands being close to the stumps, but the third umpire has seen enough to conclude that O'Brien's throw broke the wickets

good length outside off, goes forward, not to the pitch as he tries to drive this on the up with a closed-face. Leading edge flies past short third man and he has to give chase. Pulls it back and tumbles over the boundary
back of a length in the corridor, back foot defence
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep square leg
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushes on the up, across the line to mid-on
classy. Short and wide, stays upright and caresses this on the up between backward point and cover
good length at off stump, gets behind the line and pushes it to cover
full at off stump, driven to long-on off the front foot
flighted full outside off, reaches for it and taps it to long-off
back of a length at off stump, back foot punch to long-off
good length at middle stump, tries to push this into the off side, but that one went straight on and got the inside half of the bat
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
short and wide again, this one comes off the middle and and is cut through the open point region. Sweeper runs a long way to his left and puts in a slide to no avail
good length outside off, pushed to cover off the front foot

good length outside off, tries to punch this on the up, thick inside edge back to the bower who flicks it back and hits the stumps. Batsman has been standing well outside his crease, but he's in quickly enough
back of a length outside off, punched to cover
short and wide, tries to cut this hard, not in control and it goes uppishly past point and straight to third man
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
back of  a length outside off, tries to drop this into the off side and pinch a single, points closes in quickly and sends him back into the crease
full at leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, backs away too much and pushes it, slightly aerially back to the bowler
good length outside off, driven to long-off
good length outside off, gets low and chops this between point and short third man who gives yet another chase to pull it back inches from the boundary
full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, punched off the back foot to long-off
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
good length at leg stump, glanced to fine leg off the hips
back of a length at off stump, goes back and drops it in front of point with soft hands. Gets in the way of the throw from point, but he's completed that run easily

glorious! Back of a length at off stump, transfers the weight into the off side, gets behind the line, makes enough room for the bat swing and lifts it over the midwicket boundary on the up. Superb balance from Shah
back of a length outside off, back foot punch, straight to sweeper
good length at middle stump, flicks it with the angle to fine leg
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full at off stump, flicked across the line, straight to midwicket
good length at off stump, forward defence
arm ball, good length at off stump, steps out and pushes it to midwicket
good length, fired into the pads, raps him on the leg as he tries to flick it fine
good length at off stump, gets down and sweeps on the up, he's had to reach out far and gets a top edge. Lands just in front of short fine
good length outside off stump, driven on the up to cover
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full at leg stump, punched on the up through to mid-on and it's yet another misfield. Peter Chase gets to the ball and falters as he bends down to pick it up, let's it straight through
back of a length outside off, this time point misfields and the cut has to be chased down by third man to his right
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off, whipped to midwicket off the back foot
good length at middle stump, punched off the back foot to try and find long-on, but Stirling dives to cut it off
good length outside off, leans into the drive and gets it to the left of mid-off, who slides to cut it off
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler on the up
good length outside off, opens the face and cuts it late, straight to short third man
back of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
back of a length in the corridor, tapped into the off side off the back foot
full at off stump, short stride and pushed straight to mid-on
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full at off stump, tries to squeeze this through the covers, the bat turns in his hands and he can only find mid-on
back of a length outside off, pushed off the back too to cover
full at middle stump, punched down the ground to long-on
full at off stump, driven to long-on
good length at middle stump, goes back and punches it straight to short midwicket
good length at middle stump, turned into the leg side
back of a length outside off, makes room and punches off the back foot to sweeper
back of a length at off stump, punches to try and find long-on, short midwicket gets across to his left and puts in a dive
full at middle stump, can't find long-on with the drive again, this time it's Stirling who puts in a dive
back of a length at off stump, pushed to short midwicket
short and wide, cut away to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, gets on one knee and tries to chop this to third man, beaten on the outside edge as it skids through
good length outside off, pushed to long-on, on the up
good length at off stump, sliced on the up, straight to point
dropped short outside off, frees his arms and opens the face as he cuts, gets it past point
good length outside off, steps out and pushes it back to the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, turned to short fine off the back foot
good length outside off, forward defence

gorgeous shot. Good length outside off, goes down the track, not quite to the pitch of the ball, but he goes through with the shot and keeps his shape. Mid-off is in the circle and this goes straight over his head
back of a length at middle stump, tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
short at middle stump, flicked off the back foot to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, back foot punch to find sweeper cover
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, jammed out to short cover
short and wide, hurriedly moves back and across and gets a lot of power on the cut, but it is straight to the point fielder
full and angled into the pads, flicked with the angle, straight to deep square leg
good length, angled into the pads, hangs back and tickles it past short fine leg
back of a length at off stump, punched to short midwicket
short at middle stump, shapes to full, brings in a straight bat last moment as it slides low, pushes it to deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
short outside off, middles the back foot punch, straight to cover
back of a length at off stump, finds cover again with the back foot punch
back of a length at middle stump, driven to long-on off the back foot
back of a length outside off, bunted on the up to the left of extra cover
short and wide, cuts hard, finds point once more
full at leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length at off stump, pushed to cover off the front foot
good length, angled in at leg stump, pushed to short midwicket's right, where Stirling puts in a dive
full at off stump, driven straight to cover
back of a length outside off, hangs back and drops it into the leg side with his wrists
full outside off, leans into the drive and finds long-off
full outside off, skips down, gets close to the pitch and flicks it to deep square leg
dropped short at middle stump, pulls this uppishly, but doesn't get any power and it goes to deep midwicket after a few bounces
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length at middle stump, pushed to short midwicket
good length outside off, driven on the up to sweeper cover
short and wide, opens his arms up and slams it to sweeper cover
full outside off, gets on one knee, and squeezes it out to sweeper cover to bring up his 7th ODI fifty
good length, slower ball outside off, pushed to point with an open face
full and into the pads, flicks it behind square, to the right of deep square leg and that's his fifty as well
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
back of a length outside off, pokes away from his body and it flies to point on the bounce
back of a length outside off, pushed to cover, away from the body
full outside off, makes room and drives on the up to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
good length at off stump, no feet as he drives straight to cover with his stumps exposed
short and wide, pushed to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
good length, drifted into the leg stump, pushed to short midwicket
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover

he's picked the fielder. Arm ball, angled in at off stump, he hangs back, gets low and wants to slog this through midwicket. But it skids on quickly, his bat turns and he picks out short midwicket who takes it low under his eyes. Wasn't to the pitch of the ball and that shot is difficult to pull off on this pitch if you aren't
good length at the pads, pushed into the square leg region off the front foot
full at leg stump, steps out and pushes it to long-on
good length, angled down the leg, he gets bat on this to try and nudge it past the keeper but he has anticipated this nicely and stops it on the bounce with an outstretched dive to his left
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
loses his shape. Back of a length, angled in at middle stump, clears the front foot and tries to hoick this over deep midwicket, but gets an inside edge into the square leg region
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot

back of a length outside off, steps out and flat-bats this over mid-on. The bat turns slightly in his hands and it's gone over the boundary on the bounce, as third umpire is trying to confirm....yes, that's a four. Took longer than it should have.
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, stays leg side of the ball to make room and picks the gap at the midwicket boundary with a sweep. Good batting.
good length, angled in at leg stump, pushed to short midwicket's left
good length at leg stump, steps out and pushes on the up to long-on
good length at middle stump, forward defence
full at off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length at middle, goes deep and tries to pull, thick inside edge as the ball skids on with the angle, straight to deep square
back of a length at off stump, punched to deep cover
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
full at off stump, driven back at the bowler
back of a length at off stump, hangs back and swats into the leg side
back of a length outside off, pushed to point off the thick outside edge
good length outside off, pushed to short midwicket
good length, angled in at leg stump and beats him on the inside edge, straight into the pads, as he tries to push to long-on
full at leg stump, gets the front leg out of the way, gets under it and middles the slog sweep over the midwicket boundary
back of a length at middle stump, punched off the back foot to long-on

back of a length at off stump, tries to punch this on the up, the balls sits in the pitch and he's through the shot too early. Not in control as this turns into a chip that goes wide of extra cover and to long-off
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
short and wide, opens his arms and slaps it on the up, straight to deep cover
short and wide outside off, no feet as he throws his arms at this and is beaten
good length outside off, dropped in front of cover with soft hands
good length outside off, crunched to deep cover, no feet movement
steps out premeditatedly, turns out he's running at a short ball. Cramps himself, squeezes it out to short fine from chest height

lazy shot. Good length outside off, very slight movement away, but it's his lack of feet movement that has done him in, not the ball's. Pokes at it a couple of yards outside the off stump, gets an outside edge through to the keeper
full at off stump, pushed to mid-off
low full toss at off stump, driven to sweeper cover off the toe of the bat
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to long-on
back of a length at off stump, punched to cover off the back foot
back of a length, angled in at middle stump, makes room and slices it to deep cover
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length at off stump, tapped back to the bowler off the front foot
good length outside off, driven to mid-off on the up
full at middle stump, short midwicket dives to his left to cut off the drive towards long-on
full at leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
good length outside off, this one keeps low and skids from under the bat as he slashes away from the body
full outside off, steps out, gets to the pitch and lifts it over mid-off. Got the bottom of the bat, but had enough to clear the infield
full outside off, driven to deep cover
short and wide from around the wicket, angled across the batsman, he chops it late, in the air, keeps short third man interested briefly but this bounces well to his left
good length outside off, pushes it to cover's left and sends his partner back after he's down halfway
good length outside off, pushed past cover
full outside off, sliced to deep cover away from the body
back of a length outside off, punched to deep cover off the back foot
full toss at off stump, driven straight to deep cover

...and that was the shot of a tired man as well. Good length at middle stump, decides he's had enough of the straight bat singles, backs away and tries to slog this over long-on on the up. The pitch is low, and slow, and there isn't enough power on that. Long-on didn't have to move
good length at off stump, pushed to cover off the front foot
good length at middle stump, defended to cover off the back foot
good length at leg stump, flicked off the pads to deep square leg
full and wide outside off, slices this uppishly, straight to deep cover
short and wide outside off, skids low, he keeps his eyes on it and chops it to third man
back of a length at off stump, back foot defence
back of a length at middle stump, dropped into the leg side off the back foot, to the right of midwicket
good length at middle stump, defended to cover
back of a length at off stump, wants to run it down to third man, but finds backward point
back of a length at middle stump, backs away and wants to crash this through the covers on the up, but it comes on slowly and he drags it into the pitch and into the non-strikers stumps
short at middle stump, hangs back, swivels and pulls between the two square fielders in the deep
good length at off stump from around the wicket, pushed to point with an open face
short at middle stump, drags this to deep square leg's left, but the fielder gets across quickly and puts in a slide
back of a length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed to cover off the back foot
back of a length slower ball outside off, wants to force this through the off side, bat turns and it's back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
full at middle stump, driven back to the bowler
slower ball, full outside off, backs away and slams it straight to cover
slower ball, short and angles across the left hander, he pulls it into the floor and straight to short midwicket
back of a length at off stump, pulled to long-on
attempted slower short ball, pushed down the leg side where the keeper gets a bad bounce and parries it towards the third man boundary and chases after it
good length at off stump, driven on the up to deep cover
back of a length at middle stump, shoveled into the leg side, straight to midwicket
good length outside off, he's shown his leg stump and lined up outside off before it arrives, beaten on the outside edge as he pokes at it
shot! Walks across the off stump again, gets low, picks the full length, paddles this to the long leg boundary
walks across again, cramped for room at a good length as he chops it to third man
back of a length at the pads, flicked to midwicket
full at off stump, driven to long-off
good length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length, wide outside off, frees his arms and slaps it on the up over cover
good length at the pads, steps out, pushed to midwicket
full and wide outside off, jammed out to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, dragged to long-on on the up
back of a length at middle, rotates a full 360 degrees on his back leg after pulling this straight to deep square leg
low full toss outside off, steps out and drives it to sweeper cover
full at off stump, slams it past the bowler who can barely put his hand out. Long-off gets across to his right
full toss outside leg stump, premeditated sweep, straight to deep cover
full and wide outside off, he hasn't quite reaches this but goes through with the shot, and lifts it wide of long-off
ooooooh! Good length outside off, hangs in the crease, gets down and creams the slog sweep on the up over the midwicket boundary
yorker outside off, sneaks under the bat, beaten
brilliant shot. Full outside off, throws his hands out and slices it square on the off side, finds the gap between backward point and sweeper
good length, cutter, wide outside off, tries to slam this on the up through the off side, big edge, carries to the keeper's left
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover

and another for O'Brien. Good length at off stump, walks across and sets himself up for a big slog, cramps himself for room and doesn't middle it. Flies towards long-on who runs in and takes a neat catch low as he's sliding
good length outside off, pushed into the off side
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
back of a length slower ball outside off, chopped straight to point
full outside off, pushed to cover with soft hands
full outside off, flicked into the leg side with soft hands, strategically placed to deep midwicket's left
good length outside off, poked to backward point
full outside off, driven to cover
good length at the pads, pushed to short fine
good length, slower ball at off stump, flicked past the bowler to long-on
back of a length, quickly skids into the batsman and beats him on the inside edge as he gets tangled up on the pull
attempted slower ball, short and well wide
yorker outside off, squeezed out to long-on
good length at middle stump, dragged straight to deep square leg
yorker outside off, pushed to long-on
huge! Length ball outside off, just what he was waiting for. Stands his ground, waits for it to sit up, clears the front leg and smashes this onto the low roof at the midwicket boundary enclosure
full outside off stump, crunched straight to long-off
length ball at off stump, makes room and slams it on the up to long-off's left
full toss outside off, walks down the track, slices it between point and short third man
finally gets a slight shape away in the 49th over. Good length, outside off, he's walking at him every ball, but this one is too wide and beats his slash
full toss at middle stump, this time he stands his ground and whips it behind square
length ball outside off, hammers it on the up, on the bounce to long-off
length ball outside off, driven on the up to long-off

low full toss at off stump, walks across the stumps, gets under it and lifts it straight to deep midwicket. That was tailing in and he went for the angle, but it was too close to him and he couldn't get power into it
length ball outside off, his eyes lit up, his arms swung at it naturally, but his eyes were already looking over the long-off boundary before the ball arrived. Beaten
slower ball, full outside off, hangs back, waits for it and turns it through the slip region
yorker outside off stump, jammed to long-off
slower cutter, at a length on off stump, clears the front leg and tries to slog this over midwicket, slices it high and well in front of long-on
yorker outside off, dragged out to long-on
fuller outside off, comes forward and opens the face of his bat to steer towards third man
fuller length ball on off, stays in the crease and blocks
short of a length and outside off, punches it off the backfoot down to long-off
back of a length, stays in the crease and tucks it off the backfoot behind square
fuller length and on the stumps, tucked off the pads through midwicket for a single
pitched up on off, flat and angling in from around the stumps, gets forward into a nice stride and pushes it into the off side
fuller ball, angled across on off and gets some movement in the air as it ends up coming closer to off, defended watchfully off the front foot
full and angling away outside off, reaches out for it and crunches a drive square of the wicket. Backward point gets down to his left but misfields slightly and that allows them the run
length ball, tries to tuck it into the leg side but misses and wears it on the pad instead
full and on the stumps, no movement, defended back to the bowler

good length ball outside off, stands tall in the crease and slashes it through covers with a slat bat. Between cover and extra cover. uses the depth of the crease by shifting back and the bowler has overstepped

drops it short again on the free hit ball and the ball is pulled away. Not timed too well and the ball is pulled back before the deep midwicket fence. He thinks it will go four four and jogs the single, but sprints back for the second as it begins to stop in its tracks
straight and on the stumps, defended carefully with a straight bat towards mid-off
walks away and manufactures room before opening the face of his bat to slap it away but cannot beat point
comes down the track and meets the pitch of the ball before drilling it wide of mid-on

ooh, nicely bowled. Comes forward and plays for the turn but the ball comes on with the arm and goes from between bat and pad, beats the inside edge and misses the off stump as well as it goes to the keeper
comes down the track to take it on the full before pushing it to long-off to get off strike

that's a soft dismissal. Strangled down the leg side. It's a harmless length ball on leg stump channel and spinning further down leg. Joyce tries to tuck it off the pads and ends up getting an edge to the wicketkeeper
fuller ball on off, defended off the front foot to covers. Non-striker wants the single but is sent back as the fielder there as has put in a diving save

sprayed down the leg side. Tries to flick it away but wears it on the pad and the ball goes down to the fine leg region. Actually, seems like he has got a bat to it as the umpire has made no signal of leg bye

Dropped. Sprayed down leg and that could have been a repeat of the previous dismissal. Stirling this time has got a bat to it. Shahzad dives to his left and sticks out the left glove but ends up not being able to hold on to it

tucked off the pads and good use of the wrists as the ball crosses the deep square leg boundary. Hamza running to his left probably needed to put in the dive, tries to stick the foot out but the ball gets away from him
short of a length ball, rides the bounce before blocking it into the off side
short of a length, stays in the crease and keeps it out to the off side, in front of point
pushed up and across from around the wicket, drilled down to long-on
sliding down leg with the arm and he comes down the track and presents a straight bat to push it out to long-off

appeal for stumping and they go upstairs to refer it. It was pushed across and drifting outside off. Nice, tossed up, loopy delivery, tempting him into the front foot drive. The batsman comes forward and the ball beats the outside edge. His backfoot comes out slightly and Shahzad is quick to take the bails off. He has slid it back in but the question is if part of the foot was inside the line. Seems like they need another angle. Seems like a part of the foot is inside the line from one angle, but the other angle suggests on the line. Who will the benefit of doubt go to? It goes to the batsman

flat and short of a length. And that is not the best of efforts from extra cover. The batsman was backing away and uses the depth of the crease to slap it away through extra cover. Man there, he gets down but not quickly enough and the ball goes to the boundary
short and wide, slapped off the backfoot through covers
drift takes it away from the left-hander from a fullish length. Porterfield is drawn forward and attempts a drive but the ball goes off the outside part of the bat to backward point
short of a length and just outside off, packed off side field with six fielders and he slaps it but cannot beat backward point
full and angling in on middle and leg, clipped away to mid-on
waits at the crease and opens the face of his bat to run it down to third man
back of a length ball, lots of vacant spaces in the leg side field and he tucks it off the pads through midwicket
full and outside off, holding its line on the fourth-stump channel, closes the face of his bat as he goes through with the drive to send it straight, past mid-off for a boundary
full and on the stumps, opens the face of his bat as he push-drives this into the off side
good length on off, waits for it before punching it out to covers
fuller and outside off, crunches a drive off the front foot to covers
good length ball, angling in on middle, defended with a straight bat to the right of the bowler
length and sliding further down this time, on middle and leg, kept out

lucky boundary. Tries to pull and it does not get up as much as he would have liked. Short of good length and there is not enough room either. Goes through with the pull and the lack of bounce means the ball goes off the bottom edge, misses the stump and into the fine leg boundary
length ball on the stumps, straightens and the bat face opens as he pushes it into the off side
flat ball and some width on offer outside off, tries to slap it away but it keeps a bit low and he can only drag it down to long-off
flat and on a length, on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
bowled with a flatter trajectory, comes on at an even bounce, pushed to long-on
waits for it at the crease before turning it away into the leg side
flays it to long-off with a flat bat
comes down the track and pushes this with a straight bat down to long-on
good length ball, angling in on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
short of a length and angling in, tucked off the pads to deep fine leg
length ball, angling in just outside off, punched off the backfoot
good length ball on middle and leg, tucked with the angle to midwicket

short ball, picks the length up early and lays into a pull shot. Sitting up nicely and he elegantly pulls it away to deep midwicket, rolls the wrists to control it and makes sure it goes wide of the short midwicket fielder. That's the 50 up for Ireland

short of a length ball, punched firmly off the backfoot to shhort extra cover. Non-striker takes off for a non-existent single and has to hurry back. Throw fired at the bowler's end but it misses the stumps and there is no one backing up
eased down to long-on
wide outside off, tempts him into a drive and the batsman comes forward and gets beaten
shorter in length and punched off the backfoot to long-off
advances down the track and nudges it out to midwicket
turned away to midwicket again
drifting in on the pads, tucked off them to midwicket
good length on off, comes forward and opens the face of his bat to steer it to third man
short of a length and angling in on off, punched off the backfoot to covers

fuller this time and outside off, punched off the front foot to short extra cover and the non-striker is again backing up too far. Throw at the non-striker's end, does not hit the stumps but no overthrows this time
good length on off, worked to midwicket
short of a length and some width outside off, punched out to sweeper cover
short ball, angling in and gets up nicely, around waist-height. Stirling pulls powerfully and the ball sails clean over the deep square leg boundary
short ball, keeps quite low but the batsman pulls and manages to make good enough connection as the ball crosses the deep midwicket boundary. Goes down on his knees as he pulls it, it was quite low
pitched up outside off, gets down low and reverse sweeps, just guides it fine to the third man region and the fielder running back puts in a valiant dive but cannot stop it entirely
knocks it to long-on
sliding in on leg, pushed off the front foot to long-on
gets his front foot across to this delivery outside off and closes the face of his bat to drill it down to long-on
tossed up on the stumps, defended down the pitch
full and outside off, pushed uppishly wide of mid-off
fullish length ball and nipping back in on leg, defended down the pitch. The bowler has overstepped marginally
bowled off a full toss but it's a free hit. It moves in the air and takes out off-stump as it misses the almighty swipe of Stirling
good length, angling in on off, defended with a slightly open bat face to point
good length ball on the stumps, defended to mid-on
width on offer outside off, slapped out to sweeper cover
short ball, pulled away to deep square leg, There is a man guarding the deep backward square leg fence and he runs across to cut it off
full and on the pads, clipped away to deep backward square leg
tries to play across the line and gets beaten. Short of a length and misses the pull as he gets cramped for room just outside off
sliding down on middle and leg, kept out to midwicket
full and outside off, comes forward and drives it out to sweeper cover
full and angling in, clipped away to mid-on
fuller ball, outside off, drilled back to the bowler and Naib has overstepped this time. They really need to control these

good line and length or is it? Called a wide but it's a close call. Sees the batsman back away and come down the track and he sprays it well wide of off stump and very full too. Porterfield cannot make contact with the ball. Shahzad not too pleased with the umpire's call
free-hit does not prove to be expensive. Hits the blockhole again and it can only be drilled out to mid-off
offers up a lot of width outside off and it is a fuller ball, comes forward and drives square of the wicket
good length ball, defends it with bat close to pad to point
fuller ball, nudged from the crease into the leg side
good length ball, tries to defend with a straight bat as he expects it to come on with the arm. But the ball cuts back in and hits him on the pad. Probably would have gone down leg
short of a length on off, knocks it to point
brings the bottom hand into play and drills this fuller ball off the inside part of the blade to mid-on
good length and angling in on off, punched off the backfoot to covers
good length and slightly wider outside off, stays in the crease and drops it in front of covers. The bowler runs across and fields it
comes forward and defends it out to covers. no run again
and another off, still cannot pierce the off side field. Slightly short of good length and outside off, worked to backward point
full and angling in on middle, tucked away to deep midwicket
good length ball, defended back to the bowler

reverse sweep and the ball races away to the third man boundary. Pitched up outside off, too full to play a drive effectively, so he goes for the reverse sweep instead. Hits it hard but at the same time is in great control
knocks it to backward point after coming forward to meet the pitch of this length ball
tries to come forward and nudge it away but the ball drifts in and grips. Stops a bit and he chips it uppishly back to the bowler but safe in the end
comes forward and blocks into covers
advances down the track to meet the pitch of this one before driving it to long-on
reverse sweep again. Pitched up and gives quite a bit of width outside off. Gets it past the left of short third man to bring up his fifty and the 100 for Ireland
back of a length outside off, punched square of the wicket
angling in to the left-hander, tucked behind square
fuller and just a tad wide outside off, tries to slap it away but does not make good connection as the ball goes to cover. Tries to hit it too hard by bringing the bottom hand into play
full and wide outside off, opens the face of his bat to run it down to third man
full and wide, flays it to mid-off who is slightly back
full and wide outside off, comes forward and pushes it a little more gently to mid-off to give himself the time to take a very sharp single
given too much air and down the leg side, gets down to sweep and gets it very fine as the ball gets past the wicketkeeper and beats the fielder giving it a chase to go into the boundary
lot of flight and on leg stump again, swept hard and this time the ball beats the dive of the fielder at the deep square leg region
sprayed down the leg side. He is struggling with his line to left-handers here. Porterfield tries to tuck it away but the ball spins away further down leg
nudged into the leg side
sliding in and pitched up on leg, clipped to midwicket
googly, picked up very early by Stirling who backs away to stay leg side of it and give himself the room to punch it out to backward point
slider in the corridor, comes on straight, lets it go
flat fullish ball, defended off the front foot back to the bowler
flat and on the stumps again, comes forward and drops it into the off side for a quick single
fired in flat and quick, tucked off the backfoot through midwicket
comes forward and taps this in front of cover for a single
makes room for himself and cuts but cannot beat short extra cover as the ball keeps a bit low
comes on to the front foot and drives with bat close to pad back to the bowler
pitched up outside off, driven out through covers for a single
tries to tuck off the backfoot but the ball spins in to him from leg stump channel, straightens into him and hits him on the pad. Would have missed leg
tossed up outside off, given too much air and bowls a low dipping full toss that is pushed down to long-off
fuller and outside off, uses his wrists to drill it down to long-on
flighted and pitched up outside off, it's the googly and is squeezed out square of the wicket
pitched up on leg, swept away to deep square leg
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
comes down the track to meet the pitch of this delivery before nudging it to midwicket
comes forward and defends into the off side
fuller on middle and leg, gets the front leg towards off and reverse sweeps through point
comes forward and pushes it to covers
comes forward to this fullish length ball and pushes it away through the vacant spaces in covers
tucked with the turn to midwicket
comes forward and pushes this fuller ball with bat close to pad to long-off
width on offer outside off, chases it after reaching out and pushes it off the outer part of the bat to backward point. Fifty for Stirling
worked back to the bowler
full toss, comes forward and pushes uppishly as the ball goes a couple of bounces to mid-off
front foot out of the way, moves towards off and sweeps it in a flash to deep backward square leg
comes forward and taps it between point and cover
clipped off the pads, with the angle, to backward square leg
pushed off the front foot to long-on
defended back to the bowler
comes forward and punches this straight down the ground, between long-on and long-off. They both converge on it and it is cut off just in front of the boundary
punched off the backfoot towards mid-off
tucked off the pads through square leg

oh, what a delivery. That's a dream of a delivery. On a length and spinning away after drawing the batsman forward. The wicketkeeper takes the bails off and they go up in appeal for a stumping. Seems like the backfoot has come up and this seems touch and go. Has he just planted a toe in when the bails are off? Remember, he has already had a life. This is really close. And it seems like the toe has just been put back in, green light comes on and Afghanistan have to wait further to get a breakthrough
sliding in with the arm on a fullish length, comes down the track and drills it to long-on
reverse sweep, for once, he has not made good connection on it. It goes along the ground and there is a short third man for the shot and he will intercept it
cutting back in from short of good length and it is tapped to backward point
oh, shot. What a shot. Low full toss outside off, crunches a cover drive off the front foot and the ball screams away into the boundary
tucked to midwicket for a sharp single and the bowler runs across to pick it up
waits in the crease and plays it very late to point
short of a length ball, swivels around and pulls it along the ground to deep fine leg
short ball, is late with the pull as the ball goes through square leg, rolls the wrists, though, and keeps it along the ground as deep backward square leg runs across and fields it
flat and width on offer outside off as it spins away, slapped off the backfoot to sweeper cover
short and keeps a bit low but the batsman makes good connection.. Half-tracker dispatched through deep square leg. Backward square leg runs across but the ball beats him
poor short ball again and this time it is pulled behind square. Man at square leg runs across and fields it
short ball, pulled off the backfoot to deep midwicket where there is a fielder
fuller and on leg stump, tries to clip it away and gets it off the pad into the on side
too full and on the pads, gets down to sweep and the ball goes to the fine leg boundary, beats the fielder who gives it a good chase
fullish length ball on leg stump, pushes it with a straight bat to mid-on
some width on offer outside off, punched off the backfoot in front of mid-off and they steal a sharp single. Great running to bring up the 150 of the partnership
full and outside off, not much pace, drilled out to sweeper cover
length ball, pushed across and straightening late, tucked off the pads. It's the leg cutter and he picks it quickly before glancing it to fine leg
fuller and just outside off, drops it in front of point for a quick single
full and on the pads, clipped away hard but straight to midwicket fielder. Lucky to get away with it. Another great over for Ireland
pushed across and straightening outside off, left alone
drags it short and pulled with the turn out to deep midwicket
pushed off the splice of the bat into the off-side, in the direction of mid-off

oh, gone. Off the splice again and this time it has been chipped straight back to Rashid who gets a good low catch.  It's the wrong'un bowled from the back of the hand and not picked up by the batsman who pushes it uppishly back to Rashid
shuffles across and tucks off the backfoot to short fine leg
That's the wrong'un again and Porterfield plays it in front of the pads. Lucky that he brings the bat down in time. Would have been plumb in front had he missed it
pushed off the splice into the off side
defended into the off side off the front foot
pitched up and on off, defended with bat close to pad
comes forward to meet this length ball and defends it back towards the bowler
fuller and angling in from outside off, pushed off the front foot into the off side
fuller length ball, comes forward and taps it into the off side, in front of covers for a quick single as the throw misses the stumps at the non-striker's end
opens him up with a googly and beats him as he does not pick it and walks into the shot as he defends
tries to tuck off the pads but the ball goes off the pad to short fine leg. Optimistic appeal for leg before, but it was missing leg
goes for the big drive and gets it just to the right of the fielder there who dives
goes for an expansive drive again. Width on offer and Porterfield goes after it. Spins in late and beats the bat
pushed off the front foot to the left of the bowler and Porterfield takes off for the single but Niall O'Brien is ball-watching, they end up completing the single
short and outside off, punched to covers
flat and wide outside off, slapped down to long-off
full and on middle, defended off the front foot back down the pitch
flighted outside off, driven off the front foot through covers
shifts back and punches this wide of sweeper cover. Comes back for the second to raise his hundred, ninth of his ODI career. What a knock.
tries to cut but not enough width and close to of as well, he chops it towards point
full and outside off, driven with an open bat face to backward point
full outside leg stump from around the wicket, reverse sweep straight to backward point
tossed up outside off from over the wicket, steps out, not to the pitch, closes the face on it and just about pushes to short fine
full at the pads, gets low and dispatches the sweep behind square, and the deep fielder has now chance to his left
good length at middle stump, tucks it off the front foot to deep midwicket
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket's left off the front foot
full at middle stump, driven to deep midwicket's right
full at leg stump, swept straight to short fine
good length outside off, gets low and drags the sweep out to long leg
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
short and wide outside off, punched straight to extra cover
good length at off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
good length at off stump, forward defence
good length, angled across from outside off, thick outside edge down to third man as he pushes off the front foot
full and wide outside off, reaches out and drives with the toe of the bat to sweeper cover

...oh and he nearly gets him! Rolls his fingers on this good length ball outside off, he steps out and tries to pick the extra cover region, another thick edge. Slip is wide, but this goes wider than him
back of a length at middle stump, turns it towards fine leg aerially, he runs in and does well to hold onto the ball on the bounce as he slides
short and wide, slashes at it without feet, beaten
gives him the charge, tries to pull this short ball, but it's wide down the leg side

good length outside off, provides him with an angle that he utilizes as he slashes this behind square on the up. Sweeper cover gets across and slides to push this in, but third umpire replays show he's touched the rope
dropped short at middle stump, swivels and pulls to long leg's right, he puts in a slide and keeps it to a single

full at off stump, he's playing for the angle and and has completely missed this. Tries to push it to long-off, but his bat is a couple of inches away from the ball as it strikes his pad right in front of off stump
short and wide outside off, chops at this hard and gets a thick outside edge that flies past slip
good length at off stump, pushed off the front foot to deep point
short and at leg stump, whipped to short fine leg
good length at off stump, hurries him and he gets an inside edge onto pad. That looked close, pad and bat were really close together
good length, tailing in at off stump, forward defence
good length, tails in at middle stump, raps him on the upper half of his front leg, but the appeal is turned down. Looked high and might have gone down leg
back of a length at off stump, punched to mid-off on the up
full and wide outside off, thumps a cover drive to sweeper cover's left

he's chipped it to extra cover! Full ball outside off, looks like it has stopped on him as he goes for to cover drive again. The bat turns in his hand and floats in front of Shenwari who dives low to his left and holds on. His feet did not move there. Afghanistan are back in this.
goes for the leg stump, yorker length, a hint of reverse there takes it down the leg side

and another! Trapped right in front. Good length, swinging in slightly again, pitches and skids off the pitch, straight at leg stump. Wilson rooted to his crease, nervously tries to get bat on it but doesn't manage to. Up goes for the finger
wide of the crease, fires this down the leg side
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
wide of the crease, full at leg stump, driven to long-on
full at off stump, flicked to short midwicket
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
full at leg stump, chips it on the bounce to short midwicket
short of good length, the batsman tries to tuck it away but misses and wears it on the pad. That pitched outside leg probably, so appeal for lbw turned down
full and wide outside off, drives it away from the body and the bat face opens slightly as the ball goes to backward point
length ball on leg stump, tucked off the pads to deep backward square leg
good length, angling in on off, dabs it away to midwicket and sets off for a single. Throw fired at the striker's end, direct hit would have been interesting but it is not to be
full and outside off, Thompson drives on the up but cannot place it well. Picks out mid-off who runs an inch or two to his left and snaffles it. Ireland in more than some trouble here.
very full ball, almost a yorker, dug out to short fine leg
length ball, stays in the crease and runs it towards covers for a quick single
short of a length and some width on offer outside off, punched off the backfoot to covers
comes down the track and nudges it to midwicket
very full ball, pushed along the ground to long-on
full and sliding on leg, pushed off the front foot to extra cover

is that a stumping? No, seems like the foot was planted. Length ball, spinning away, draws the batsman forward and he has to come forward by some distance. Gets beaten and the keeper takes the bails off. But the foot never came off
full ball, clubbed hard straight back to the bowler and it seems like it has hit him on the foot before it goes into the leg side. Banged straight and hard
good length, spinning away, beats the outside edge as the batsman prods on the front foot
back of a length and outside off, chops it to short third man after opening the face of bat late
looking to make room for himself but it's the googly and spins in, he manages to work it to extra cover
wide outside off and again spinning in the other way, cut to sweeper cover

disaster averted. Fuller ball outside off, driven straight to extra cover and they take off for the single. Direct hit was needed at the non-striker's end but he misses. The batsman was jogging, he had given up
short of a length, tucked off the backfoot to the right of the bowler who charges across and fields
short and wide, cut to backward point
sliding in on leg, clipped off the toes uppishly to deep midwicket
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover

gone. Superbly done. Oh, what a delivery. He was backing away to make room and the bowler fires it flat, lack of flight and on a length. He comes forward and looks to flick it away but the ball spins away from him and he ends up walking into the shot. Shahzad does the rest
worked to deep square leg for a single
good length ball outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off
wrong'un, keeping low as it spins away from the left-hander, who does not pick it, and misses off-stump by not much
consecutive googlies. Not picked again and skews it off the outside part of the bat to backward point
sliding in to him, tucked with the angle to backward square leg

gone. That looked plumb. Flat length ball and he expects it to come on with the arm and seeing that it is drifting away, opens up his arms to cut. But he is no position to play it as the ball spins in to him and strikes him on the back pad in front of middle and leg
spinning in, googly again, picked up this time and tucked off the pads to midwicket
comes down the track to take this on the full before pushing it back to the bowler
tucked off the pads to midwicket
advances down the ground and nudges this through midwicket for a single
walks down the track and the bowler drags the length back. Slapped to sweeper cover
short ball, pulled out to deep midwicket
comes down the track and shovels this through extra cover. There is a fielder and he gets down to his right but the ball beats him to the boundary

flat ball, spinning away, does not make great connection on the pull but he has picked the gap to send it to the deep midwicket boundary. The fielder there is slightly inside, more than to the bowler's liking certainly, and he makes his displeasure known
tossed up outside off, comes forward to defend and gets beaten. Rooted to the crease and pushing at it

that's the quicker ball. Stays in the crease and plays for the turn. But the ball merely straightens and goes past the inside edge to rap him on the pad. Easy call for the umpire, that hit him in front of middle and leg
sliding in with the arm, tucked off the pads to deep fine leg. Fielder giving it a chase but the ball beats him to he boundary
stays in the crease and pushes this down to long-on
flighted outside off, opens the bat face late and pushes this to backward point
full and wide outside off, not bothered with
stays in the crease and whips this away to midwicket with a flat bat

outside edge, past the diving wicketkeeper to the third man boundary. He puts in a great dive but the ball was dipping on him. Mulder pushes at one wide outside off without any feet and gets a thick outside edge
drops it in front of the extra cover region and they jog the single as mid-off runs in to field it
tries to clear the off-side in -field and can only get it on the bounce in front of the deep extra cover region where sweeper runs across and fields it
stays leg side of it to give himself room and gently pushes this towards the extra cover region
backs away to make room and chops this slap to mid-off
full and outside off, drilled down to long-on
fuller ball, tries to force it through the off side and skews it off the inside edge to deep fine leg
slower yorker, dips very late and the batsman is looking to get leg side of it and whip it through the on side. Misses and the ball goes from after the leg stump to the keeper

and there's the end. Comes down the track in a pre-meditated move and the bowler makes the adjustment in length. Drops it short and he has to play a forced pull late, gets a top edge for his troubles and gets it off the top edge to long-on who takes it easily
